channel.title: [Delphi]Parsing some parts of a website
channel.description:
Well, I am trying to make something with Delphi again. What I want it to do is list something from a website, like listing all the thread titles on this forum. Can you somehow scan the website without opening it or do you have to parse the sourcecode of a site?
Thanks in advance.

item.title: [Delphi]Parsing some parts of a website
item.dc:creator: @AB1 AB
item.description:
@AB1 wrote:

I think you can use a get page function and a between function?

BUT you will have to make a loop that looks for the text/thread name after the little icon thing…

Read full topic

item.title: [Delphi]Parsing some parts of a website
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

If you have server side access, it would be quite easy to do. If you don’t…Yes, you will have to parse the generated HTML. Look for a lo-fi or printable version of the forum page, it will be much easier to parse.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delphi]Parsing some parts of a website
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

If you do not parse the source, what else would you look through?

Read full topic
